content: This installment for me feels like where it ends, These first three books are amazingly well written and I love the story.. Sadly the 4th book takes a wrong turn, while still well written.. It just feels like the previous 3 books didn't matter in the 4th book, It feels cheated with a forced path away from what what I enjoyed about the previous 3. I'm hoping there will be a 5th book to help get the story back to where it should be.

Pointless having a RO in the series like Momoko if they aren't going to be in the whole series to spend time with. Hated that she was written out of Book 3 just so time could be given to newer characters.
Love it cant wait for book 5 already üò≠

In the previous two Hyuga games, it wasn't uncommon for me to have to restart because choices I thought made sense for the ronin and my attunement decreased too much. However, I have never had to restart as many times as I have had to with this book. Before I was even a quarter of the way in I had already found the need to restart 3 times. The choices feel more luck based than anything, with little logic as to what makes one right and one wrong. Very frustrating. Hope this trend does not continu
Least favourite of the three books so far, mainly due to the story. Would still recommend.

Love the whole series. It is action/drama/suspense/sex so packed that I almost don't breathe half the time. Also the world and characters are built with such thoughtfullness, detail and care...can't even fathom how much work it has to take to the author. One of the greatest "gamebooks" i read (and I read a LOT). Can't wait for another book.

Such a letdown from the past 2 installments. Difficult and punishing skill checks, unintuitive guessing games, and a plot that veers all over the place. No room for character development or choices that make any sense - I may as well have gone with a premade character. My choices didn't matter and I just felt like a voyeur on my own character. It's the longest book yet and I found myself wildly clicking options praying it would end soon.

I do wish it's a bit longer, especially the second part for there's really bunch of character development to be covered as well as emotional buildup, but that's my only complaint. Thrilling as ever. Edit: Just finished the last chapter. Now emotionally wrecked.
I really enjoyed this installment but oh boy, did it pull on my heartstrings!

I get the point of the story but it could've been framed better. For the entire second half, there's practically no way to get a choice "correct". The character I shaped isn't in this book. I might as well have premade a character. The first two were great but this one really dropped the ball. Not to mention what go does attuning my spirit do? Plus, any time it "increases" it really goes down. I'll play through the series but I'm not expecting much.

this one is ok. it honestly feels like with each book the choices just get more vague in how they're different. things that seem like they would go with a choice just end up giving you harsh penalties.
Its has nice scenes. But then it goes and contradicts itself. Like i want to be a bad person why cant i have that instead of being captain saveahoe
I love the series but this book just seemed out of place. Would love a return to something closer to books 1 or 2 for the fourth one.

Most complaints are that the game is a bit tedious to restart and really frustrating with the lack of clairty regarding choices in discussion Im inclined to agree as Ive invested many hours into rereading parts to maximize my attunement and grown incredibly frustrated with options that fit my characters personality often leading to me being penalized for a simple response this book is ok but does no justice for the other 2 books I adivse caution with this one only read if you got the stomach
Amazing, 10/10, worth the money 100%! My favorite text based game ü•∞‚ù§ I may or may not be in love with half the characters...may or MAY NOT. Dont judge me.
I love it
Best choice game series out there

More action than the previous book but very inconsistent choices that penalize you harshly especially during vague or very similar options. Very frustrating and can uproot your game and damage the story you've been forming across 3 books. I've enjoyed the series but this one was too frustrating.
GOOD
Only reason it ain't 5 stars is because of the tedious text input choices which I have to retype every TIME I restart so that I can finally reach 100% attunement. Still a pretty good read though.
PLEASE make a book 5 PLease! I would even pay 40 bucks for a book 5 PLEASEEEE
Amazing
Wow
A bit of a letdown compare to the first 2 book, but still a nice read. Looking forward to book 4. Edit: Been a year and still no sign of book 4, is it abandoned?
Great, gimme book 4 pls
It's been a year or 2 since I've read this. I really want to hope that more is to come. It's like waiting for Liru all over again.
I love the Samurai of Hyuga books so much! The writing is so engaging, I've already played them several times. PLEASE I need there to be more. I can't wait for Samurai of Hyuga 4!!!!!

The entirety of the Samurai of Hyuga book series possesses some of the best writing I've ever read in terms of the atmosphere it presents. The book reads as a vivid and intense graphically raw image that is so ever-prevelant in Anime and Japanese lore in general. It also presents the classical dark vs light path spiritual theme that is philosophical and relatable in the fantasy genre; which melds perfectly in a world that feels like the historical Japanese culture and myths of the Middle Ages.
love all of them
The wait was worth it! SoH 3 was by far one my favorite one.  It was an emotional roller coaster ride that really left an impression on me.    I really look forward to Book 4!!
I love this series ‚ù§Ô∏è
Loved it can't wait for the next
i am looking forward to book 4 i wanted more interactions with junko i feel that she is the best character but thats my opinnion since i like the crazy hehe >~>
love the series and hope it continues
I can't wait for more! it's a wonderful series
Love the cr*p out of this, the series even... Hope there is more in the works. Great work devs and of course the author (^_-)

Had my doubts when I heard it was more of a detective story but this is certainly gripping and exciting. Especially when you have to recall what's happened to piece together all of the clues. Great job with this well done and I can't wait for more!!

The only dissappointing thing about this is the fact, that the deduction system is only in the first part of the game, and then just lays forgotten through the rest of the story. Also, while I understand why the story was cut like this (tension from the previous game, so people buy this one, etc.), it would have been better, if we had a single demon death per game. Specifically, the forgetting part could have been a very good stand-alone story driver.
Fantastic

Good continuation of the series. I feel as though this series could go on for several more books/games based simply on the way that the author is keeping the story fresh and not too clich√©d. My only critisism if you want to call it that, is that it is difficult to tell how your relationships, romantic and otherwise are going because there is no meter or anything like what you find in similar games. I also hope that the author adds more into the romantic aspect of the game because that is lacking
is there going to be a book 4 and if so when is the project relase date?

this is an excellent new chapter in rhe series, getting into somw grittier and darker themes not seen since the beginning of the second book. i recommend if you enjoyed the first book, you will enjoy your way to this one too.

Omg love this story. Not an easy game to "beat" or get everything correctly for your character's development. Puts you in someone else's mindset very heavily. Makes you really think about these situations. Kind of like an anime show: overarching story is fun and lighthearted and sarcastic, but the subplot is dangerous, psychological, sexy, disturbing. Even with all the magic the book is incredibly real in emotions and desires. Each character is carefully constructed: its almost like the character that the player creates isn't the main character of the book. As an app, it functions perfectly. As a story, very well planned, consistent, in depth, fun, etc. Incredibly excited for the next book. My only inquiry is whether or not there is a way to delete saved game files? I have quite a few and it's difficult to keep track of them.
gr8
This was a very layered symbolic piece of Adam and Eve in my opinion. Very Biblical!
my favourite of them all
Hopefully you're making book 4
Hurry up with the other ones plz

Nowhere near as entertaining as the previous book with each choice apparently being wrong even if it's something that would have worked prior. I only get more frustrated with each supposed answer being a pitfall.
Amazing all of them
Good story

Finally have had a chance to read the 3rd installment and while there are many complaints that your choices don't matter or what-have-you, do not be dissuaded to read it regardless. This is just as gripping and enveloping as the first 2 books and I wait at the edge of my seat for the 4th installment. I will buy each book and read them whole heartedly whether it ends on the next book or a thousand more are written. The cultural emphasis, the drama, the pictures painted with a thousand words...I love this series like no other.

I waited eagerly for it's released, I became a fan of the previous two. They story was well done I enjoyed it, through a little disappointed my character became a weak ass fighter during pretty much all the combat and sparring with your allies and enemies, overall good job. Now I can't wait for part 4
Love it been reading/playing since the first one

I have never bought a game as fast as this one, after going through the first 2 books multiple times I was in love with the characters, story and the setting of it all. But if I am to be perfectly honest, book 3 was left me kinda disappointed, the pacing was, to put it mildly, horrible, spending a good chunk of the book to conclude the cliffhanger from book 2 only to instantly just into a new plotline with new characters that isn't fleshed out given the limited chapters. The first 2 books promised a grand demon hunting adventure across Hyuga with a ronin and his ragtag group of misfits but book 3 is anything but that.

Like many others, I find the choices I though consistent with my character 
leads to the opposite! Many times I chose an option I didn't mean to and 
had no way of going back or lost an ungodly amount of attunement only to 
have to spend the rest of the chapter building up half of what I lost. Not 
only that but many "choices" are inconsequential; whether you pick A, B, or 
C, the outcome is the same. Likewise; many choices don't make sense. You 
need to make a choice with not actual info about the situation and lose 
attunement because of it!

One of my fav series on the net (as far as cyoa games go) and if anyone 
feels the same the author has a patreon where you can effect how long the 
chapters and how fast the full game comes out.
Everything that can be said has been said. Ultimately, it's worth the money.
Beautiful please I need like more books and some toshie interaction

I tried to keep character choices consistent from 1 and 2, but I keep 
getting punished for it. Also, it doesn't make sense that some 
insignificant choice will affect the attunement.

A little disappointed to be honest, tried to make the choices in line with 
the MC I've created over the previous 2 books and seemed to get punished 
alot. It always seems the author is trying to push you into certain 
choices. Still enjoyed the story and will check out the next volume just 
with a little less enthusiasm as I did with this one.

I think the fact you can add your own words to the story immerses you into 
it and really makes you pay attention to what's going on. It was so 
emotional, far more than that of the first two and I love it for that. And 
as a last parting batch of words: DAMN YOU JUNKO!!!! You'll see what I mean.

The beginning with the detective bit was interesting and a great way to 
shake things up but it felt so strange in this kind of story.
Waiting for the 4th one good job

Absolutely brilliant. Not as good as the first two. But only slightly. Just 
want to know when your planning to release the next one
I absolutely love the story and the choices you are given

I love the series and all the books but the third one this one just did not 
feel like the first it felt as though the characters choices didn't have an 
effect at all I choose to fight in the first two i did and I could at least 
do something but in this no matter what you would get your butt handed to 
you and cry about it. I don't hate the book and I love how at the end we 
can say screw it I'm going back to what I was-a manslayer and all our good 
ole roots so I hope the next will be like the first book

Absolutely love this series I'm addicted. Its so well written and detailed 
descriptions without drowning allow you to immerse yourself in the scene 
and action. I hadn't anticipated a series when I began but now I can't wait 
for book 4
There is nothing left, except wait for the next entry‚Ä¶

Unfortunately the quality has continued to fall since the first story. I actually have not even finished reading this one and I bought it many months ago. It tried to be a fancy detective story but mostly falls flat. It's not much like the books this one is built on. And although doing something new is admirable, this strays too far from what I loved about the last 2 books.so if like me you enjoyed the fights and the adventure maybe wait to see what the next book holds before slogging through this one just to see the story.

The best interactive book series to date in my opinion. I feel emotionally invested in the whole series, and I can always go back and play as a different person with different skills and traits. Very excellent.

Takes a huge step away from the other two in style. Although that isn't a terrible thing in itself, the book also seems to punish you for being consistent from the other two books. Ending was *Depressing* and unfufilling
Amazing, possibly the best of hosted games so far. Love the new gameplay with the text input.
Awesome I'm so glad my eyes are yellow again!

I loved the first two Samurai of Hyuga games, but this feels like a significant departure from those. My character, Rize, an illiterate, charming, brutally violent, generally aloof / carefree manslayer who solves basically every problem with a liberal application of violence (read: psychopath) is now behaving as a Sherlock Holmes-like detective and reacting with shock and disgust in regards to a simple murder victim - a man to whom she should have had absolutely no connection. Considering she used to be an assassin, carelessly butchered Daisuke, and gave readily into a forbidden manslaying technique in order to casually slaughter at least a dozen people and a demon, this feels significantly out of character for her.   Additionally, she hasn't gotten around to much man (or demon) slaying as of late, despite clearly having had the urge since book 2.   Finally, the choices feel arbitrary and frequently penalize you for casual conversation choices that seem like they should be in-line with your personality, while the text-based deduction / observation system has prompted me, as an achievement hound and completionist, to restart the game on numerous occasions, which makes it insanely frustrating to play through.   This game would benefit significantly from some reevaluation of, or clarity on, the attunement choices, as well as a checkpoint / save system. Please be more careful in the future with this series - I really want to love it, but the feel of book 3 has really turned me off.
Some choices seems just arbitrary, but the overall fun to read.
I absolutely loved it I hope there will be a 4th
Freaking amazing series! I cant wait for Book 4. Keep up the good work guys ^^

I've been in love with this world and the characters in it since I was first had tea with the Oyamas, to Drinking Sake from a golden fountain.  In any case I need to be honest and say that Book 3 exceeded my hopes save for two things, one is new and the other is old, something that I think would make this fantastic adventure even better. Just let us, the readers, have a checkpoint at the start and the end of the chapter so that we don't need to start over completely because of one small but important mistake. Now about the New part or "Element" in the form of the  detective work forced on you at the start. It takes away from the  ability to choose in that you have no choice. And in an interactive novel like this choice is key. Let the readers, who've gone through the detective work on a previous play, skip its Q and A sections for a more streamlined narrative which is already there. I ask that if nothing else, please look into the option of adding checkpoints, even just at the start of a chapter so one choice doesn't have the readers starting over.  Regardless of what you choose you can count on me to be of the first to buy Book 4, may inspiration and the Muses be ever by your side.

I really like this sure, and this installment, but like some others, I get as though my choices for my character were accurate to how I'd previously played him, yet my attunement went down on over half my choices. I felt penalized for staying consistent, which was strange. Also, this is not really a choose your own adventure. Rather it's just a really good, slightly interactive novel.

Love every book in the series so far this one really put my mind to the test and I can't wait till 4 comes out! Don't know when but I always find myself coming back here lookin for it jus in case üëç
Love it however i'd very much like some kinda checkpoint mechanic cuz it gets real annoying having restart after every little mistake.   Other than that though it gets 5 stars from me

The author(s) is/are amazing. I love their style and accuracy to culture. The story is long, intriguing, and captivating. The only reason I give 4/5 stars is this third book, while an amazing piece of art, had little to no real choice. It was a great read but the only thing I really influenced was attunement. If I chose an option that suited the character I created but it wasn't the choice the author intended, attunement decreased and it did the whole "wait no, that option didn't make sense so -main character- did this instead". A wonderful read and I do look forward to #4, but don't they and misrepresent it as an actual "make your own story" type.

One of the better written choices/hosted games.  It is also rather long, so the seemingly steep price is 'acceptable' in my opinion.  Great story but this particular book in the series had two things that didn't sit well with me.  The first is that the second half of the book, although well written and a great story, felt very much like a 'choose' the correct answer and less choose your own adventure. Even then, it was choose the answer that causes the least amount of damage to your stat bars because the story is going this direction whether like it or not.  The second thing I didn't like ties into the first a bit... But the MC seems to have a sudden behavioural change in the last half of the book.  (*This maybe a spoiler, but I'm making at as vague as possible.*)  It is explained, but it still feels weird.  I was doing a protective, stoic play through with the Giant Salamander spirit, and the MC is suddenly an insecure, emotional wreck.
Started different, but good. Unfortunately it went down hill as it went on

I usually don't put down reviews, but I just wanted to express how great I think this series is, and it's sad to know it'll probably end soon... But I know that you put out more great content so don't get lazy!!! And keep getting creative!!!

Finally able to buy and finish this, and I wasn't disappointed. All become more and more interesting as story progress, I also can't help but notice that the author writing improving, it's now more immersing. Not that previously it's not immersing though.  The end of book 3 leave me with bittersweet feeling, and shock (in a good way). Really hope we can say proper good bye to Masashi/Masami though, guess that the point.  The deduction and observation do can be frustrating, but I'm still enjoying it.  I don't really like interaction with romanced Toshio/Toshie though, it's few and rushed (certainly love last interaction with Toshio/Toshie though, it is leave many feeling, obligation and bittersweet are the most that I've feel). But I suppose it's understandable with how the story going. Wish MC could have more interaction with Daisuke and Borgia.  All in all SoH 3 have it's flaw here and there, but the good part of it certainly outshine it. And must say, of all HG I've played, this one are the one that leave me with many feeling the most :)  Edit: Just remember something after read others review. The attunement is really frustrating, it's raise very small but decrease quite many, this makes me restart so many times that I almost give up. Hard to determine which choice that "in character" with MC.

This book feels like its a different genre compared to the last 2 books. The 1st was like an action, the 2nd slowed down and ALMOST seemed off topic but this one has turned into some kind of mystery??? the characters have changed the way they interact with each other, talk and even think. Toshie wasn't a fighter of any sort but all of a sudden she's got someone on the ground with their arm behind their back. Sorry to pick it apart but i was looking foward to this one and wasn't expecting the change in pace and wavelength of the story
Just binge read up to this point and i can't wait for the next book, the characters are great, the storytelling well done, and the story gripping 5/5 red pandas
Really good. Though last time I played therethere flaws. Hopefully they've been fixed
Loved it, can't wait for book 4!

The Third Episode, while packed with content, highlights two major problems with Choice games: Illusion of Choice (sometimes we get two CASUAL CONVERSATION options, one of which will PENALIZE YOU) and lack of proper Checkpoints (Oh, you made a mistake? Restart.)
I NEED THE NEXT BOOK THIS SERIES IS AMAZING
Great story.

Truly remarkable. I love this series so much. When I discovered Book 3, I got so freaken excited. I was so hyped for it too that I didn't care about the price. I swear, this is the only book I am in love with that I want to write a short fanfic or draw a fanart. I wonder how the story will go in Book 4.
Attunement doesn't load
Totally worth the money I can't wait till the 4th book comes out the only thing I didn't like was that I couldn't pursue a romance with kohaku

Second time trying to write this review.  The author won't see it but oh well. The story was forced. Once you finished the baron, you were useless and people die because of your characters sudden uselessness. The choices you make are solely for your attunement, and not any real impact. The romance was short and then just utterly abandoned in the end. Your charge suddenly is gone to the wind, your whole beginning, and you barely interacted with her in the first place, and now your character is suddenly on a path to mindlessness. It jumped to much and offered no real impact. I'm not one to pick the renegade path, but how lovely dovey the bloodthirsty killer got was irritating, decades of bloodthirst washed away with weeks of friendliness, which is why the transformation ending was the only saving grace for me. Hopefully the fourth book carries on that theme.
Loved this, but I think it could have been split into two books. I look forward to the next installment!

I loved the first two books without a doubt. But this one feels like such a step away from them. First there was the sudden transformation into Dick Tracy which is far from why I played the first two books then it also felt that while I made similar choices as I had in the last two books I'm suddenly less attuned and unable to play the character as I had been before. All in all I was fairly disappointed with this one from beginning to end.
I absolutely love this series, it's by far my favorite.
Unquestionably still the best choice novel you could ever hope to find.
Really can't wait for book #4 any ideas on the release date?

Ok anybody who hasn't read all the way to the end yet should NOT read this because there will be spoilers starting now...      Omg I can't believe that ending! T-T I started crying so much. I mean the journey with everyone was amazing and to have Hatch and Masashi just taken away so quickly was heart wrenching for me. Also, on a happier note... I knew it!!! I knew the reader would eventually get together with Toshio! I shipped it since the very beginning! And on a sadder note...ejckskc!^√∑¬•-#_jdkzk You freaking took my love life away just as fast! I want to start a life with him but I'll only bring pain and suffering to the ones close to me!!! :'( This is an amazing story and I can't wait for the next book because honestly I'm still trying to keep my emotions in check after that ending...

The story is fantastic, but I had a huge problem with the stats. O felt like I didn't have a choice anymore. All the decisions felt preselected towards one path. I couldn't follow what I imagined the character to be like without everything fell apart, also the romances feel way forced. I went after Toshie, but didn't feel like she was attracted to me at all until she out of the blue confessed. I wanted it, but it felt so out of character.
Best cog series yet, and it just keeps getting better.
üëåüèΩüêùüëåüèΩüêù
Wow I was bad at this one. Glad the baron storyline was over because that was less than amazing this new one is brutal and much more page turning. Let's see our ronin get more attuned!

I love the story- all three of them! I played through this one and wasn't disappointed at all! Unfortunately I went to reinstall the other two so I could remember the details, and its telling me I have to rebuy the 2nd book, so when I have to remember that book in this one, I'm kind of screwed. And unless I buy it again, I'm stuck with the details I have from my one original save. Kind of sucks, but I like the characters and base story, so it's not that big of a deal; just a minor annoyance.
Another amazing story in this series üíöüòøüíöüòø I've loved them all! I can't wait for the next one.  Well with the money.
So addictive
Love this series have been waiting so long for book 3 and it was well worth the wait!!!!
The story felt like it mattered and i loved the heart warming experiences it left me with and the choices would of liked to know how to keep my hells release  but I'll keep going at it

I'm a die hard fan of this series, and I'm very eager for more, but something has to be done about the jarring pacing in a narrative this size. I've had to restart way too many times to maintain my attunement; a checkpoint system needs employed to avoid the slog through fill in the blank zones and/or attunement needs to be recoverable after flubs. It's just unreasonable to have to reboot the whole game 10 or 20 chapters in because one vaguely worded multiple choice ruined a massively important stat. I really want to keep patronizing this series with my cash and praise. But please, make some modifications for the comfort of your consumer.
Absolutely phenomenal. I never made a purchase so fast in my life, and A game has never warranted so many play throughs.

Pacing's a little off, feels a little rushed at some parts and the choices sometimes aren't what I expected to happen based on the text of the option. Quite entertaining overall, though, and the thing I personally like about this writing style is that sombre parts of the story doesn't get dragged on and milked.  One major complaint I have is with the Japanese scattered randomly throughout the game. The characters often say words that are sporadically replaced with their rough Japanese translation, which I feel is highly unnecessary. Also, the Japanese translations are wrong quite a few times, such as "General" translating directly to "common" in Japanese instead of the military title. I feel that if you're going to price this title at such a high price compared to others, the least you can do is hire a translator to look over your story instead of relying on Google Translate.  Not a bad title at all, could just use some quality control in many parts and it wouldn't have hurt to polish the game more before release.
I loved it :D I waited so long for this to come out xD and now I can't wait for the 4th one to come out lol keep up with the good work!!
Highly anticipated and did not let me down!! 10/10

It's a fantastic story, I read all 3 books. However, my only question is "can you prevent ige and daisuke from dying." I played through the game again and again, but to no avail. Anyways, good job. Waiting for the next one now.
(Edit). Great game. The ending as always leaving more to be desired.  Can't wait for book 4 the epicness of this series feels like it just getting started
Book 4 please!‚ô°
OH MY GOOOOD. I WANT THE NEXT BOOK. I WANT IT NOW. I LOVED THIS.
I really love this series, and move the direction it's heading, but the end of the game kinda left a bitter taste in my mouth so to speak, however it was a great story
Love this game! I have been waiting for it for so long!!!!
Every time a new book comes out I rise from my grave just to buy it

Uuuuuughhhh...  Attunement...  Restart again...  Nope...  Wrong choice!  Love Toshio!  Class dismissed!  Hyaaahhhhhh  ÔΩ•ÔæüÔæüÔΩ•(>–¥<)ÔΩ•ÔæüÔæüÔΩ•.... Goddamnit....  I love  SoH so much...  Next book üôè...

Samurai of Hyuga, the first CYOA/Multiple Choice game i ever played. When i saw that the full game needs to be purchased (SoH 1) after installing, i almost gave up. Fortunately, i decided to try out the free chapters that the game offers and let me tell you, it was the best decision i ever made. I just couldn't stop reading the story! I bought the full game just after finishing the free chapters and oh boy was i obsessed with the game. I straight up bought the second game and now the third without thinking or looking at the comments. SoH Book 3, for me is by far the  best book. It feels far more lengthier (the good kind) than the previous books and how i love the character developments in this book. It even made me care for the characters that are just being introduced in this book. Now that i finished the book, i got this sort of empty feeling inside. The ending leaves me CRAVING for book 4, I JUST NEED TO KNOW WHAT WILL HAPPEN TO MY RONIN GANG. But it'll be a long wait T.T Damn, im missing masami already.  Anyway, this book is a must buy. Simply amazing. JUST DO IT. TAP THAT BUY BUTTON.

The story for this book was fantastic. It had two distinct sections: the remainder of the Baron's arc, and the true story of Book 3. Suggestion for those buying this book: Make sure to reread the other two books, because this book will quiz you about the story thus far, and I know it's been at least a year since I played the other two books at the time of writing this, so this book left me with the worst attunement out of all three on my first run. Great book, nice style to the new attributes, and can't wait for more!

Ok, the manor part sucks arse no doubt about that.  But everything afterwards is flipping awesome and what I was looking for in part3 of this series. I look forward to the next book with much enthusiasm,  fingers crossed for a full on demon swordsman mode for my samurai.
There's just 1 thing I want to say - When's book 4?
Absolutely amazing just like the first two books
This story has piqued my interest and I want to read more of this. It made me feel sad at the fact that *spoiler alert* Ige and Daisuke died (on how the story ended for me).
This was completely worth the wait. The length, and quality just keep getting better. The only bad thing about it is the wait for book 4. Please keep this going!

I LOVE this game series, I love how you experimented with the murder mystery genre...my only complaint (SPOILERS)   IS YOU MAKING ME FEEL SO CONNECTED TO MY STUDENTS AND LEAVE ME ONLY TO SEVERE MY CONNECTIONS WITH THEM!!! UGH!!! Love you games though and can't wait for book 4
Honestly it was amazing
The best choose your own adventure. I have played tons but this one it the best. I have never bought a app so fast. Now I will wait 500 years for book 4....

The amount of times I've had to restart due to wanting to keep my attunement at a hundred is ridiculous, but well worth it. XD It may not have mattered all that much but I was adamant. I love the story too much to even care about my own frustrations. :P

I love this series so much. I'm super excited for the next book and will buy it the day it comes out. I sincerely hope I will get to romance the kid before this is over. He is so adorable, I've been holding out for that option. This one was way longer than the others and 100% worth the money.

I've been a huge soh fan, nearly dedicating all my art towards it the past two years. However, this book left me with a bad taste in my mouth.  The first half was wonderful! I loved it and it was written wonderfully. The second half, not so much.  Characters that I had previously loved seemed more two dimensional especially in the case of tosh and kohaku. They were handled clumsily and clung to the ronin faster then pacing should've allowed.

This game man, this game gave me feels. Despite being a small title, the writing kept me feeling like I was playing a triple a title. It was engrossing, so much so that I have played all three released instalments within two days. That writing man, if only we had more talent like that in the world.
Wish there was a part 4 out

Games confusing in general I am not playing again as it's not for me to confusing forced to be a detective when your a ronin who can't even read the input text mode is just stupid choices really don't tell you much like if I want to travel the path of the forbidden style how do I do that I guess what choice will help me in the last 2 books I focused on only on the forbidden style yet when it comes to this one against the baron demon I can't rely on it why I'm completely helpless against the baron well okay I just don't understand I understand the story but the everything else not so much couldn't even finish the game I just said screw it maybe 1 day I'll return but Idk I'm not a fan of the the stupid detective work

The fill in the blank instances were somewhat confusing at times. The Clue esque narrative wasn't exactly what I was hoping for in this latest book. After having such high hopes for it at the conclusion of the last two books I was left dissapointed with the departure from the style used in the other books. The story as always was well written

I want to start off by saying that I absolutely hate the author of this series just for the mere fact that I have to wait for the next book. I've really enjoyed this series and continue to look forward to what happens next.
this is the best one from the Hyuga series!!!!  Couldn't bear to wait of the next one!!!  The Samurai of Hyuga 4, I hope I dont have to wait too long
Thanks! Just amazing storytelling ^.^
Easily the best in the series so far and I can't wait for number 4

love the book bought it when it first came out I finally reached the end and it left me wondering if they plan to finish it because there were more then just 3 demons to kill. I understand the next book being about dealing with junko but it raises a lot of questions for me. I just figured junko would be the ending not half way through the series.

The story and writing just gets better. Didn't think that was possible after part 2, but damn was I wrong..  The one gripe I have with part 3 was the amount of misleading choices that have a big impact on the story/attunement. The other two parts choices were much more... explanatory? I guess..  It just bugged me how obscure and misleading some very important choices were, and the lack of checkpoints of any kind hammered that point in even more. Overall though it just gets better and better in terms of story and character development, and it was a bit longer than I expected actually, which is a good thing in this case.  And so the wait for part 4 begins. Waiting two months for part 3 was excruciating, trying not to think about how long I'll have to wait for part 4... üòÖ That being said, take all the time you need(obviously). If you can take the story in the direction I think you are and execute it well I'll be thoroughly impressed, even more than I already am.   Absolutely in love with this story and all its characters, among them the character you let us readers bring to life üòä
I love the characters, the setting, everything.
I'm kind of bugged by the fact that despite choosing all the answers that increase my attunement, it keeps going down. I reached 100% in attunement and now it's at 70% after a couple of choices.

I can't think up any other games that made me click "buy" button this fast omg lololol still awesom as always.. By the way, I love Masashi. Probably my favorite character in the whole series. Such cute boy aweeee  .. Played it. Loved it!!  Omg I can't believe it. This is getting so much more interesting even than before! I loveeeee this.
Finally book 3! Been reading these series since book 1 and loved them all. Can't wait for book 4!

Samurai of Hyuge is by far my favorite series on the app store. I cant even count how many times this book made me laugh and cry.  Reading through my Ronins experiences i felt even helped me grow as a person, a lot of what my ronin learned helped me in many ways with my own conflicts. I will always be a backer of this series, and i am eagerly awaiting the next book. :D
Can't wait for the next book, amazing story
Another great addition to the series. Book 3 was as I expected. Worth the read.

God, this was good. And far longer than I think we deserved. Wonderful storytelling. I've always been a fan of seeing how the protagonist reacts without a key ability that defines who they are. It's a great segue into tropes like 'the power of friendship' or 'discovering that the real power was in you all along'. I love these tropes when they're done well and they certainly are here.
One of the best text based CYOA games you can find.

Thrilling, intriguing and completely imersive. I love it. After reading for 5 hours the ending left me hungry for more. My emotions were in termoil. I was so immersed in the book that when it ended I just layed still for hours. Can't wait for book 4!
Loved everything about it would play again and again
Great fun.
So happy to see book 3 out!! Can't wait for book 4.
Each book gets better.

Another fantastic addition to the series, after playing the demo I thought I knew what to expect, but it really didn't prepare me for the rest of the game. Absolutely reccommended and absolutely worth the money, I already can't wait for Book 4!

An excellent and engaging third installment to the series, although I never have been a fan of the whole "take away the MCs power for them to earn back while learning some valuable lesson" trope. I understand why it's there, I just don't like it :<. Otherwise, i love how we get some character development across the board; we get to murder some demons, we get to have friends murdered, and we get some more romance options. I like the ending a lot more than the ending of book 2, the arc rounded up nicely, and it feels less cliff hanger-y, while still giving us an idea of what's coming. Taking control away from the player and reading about the MC through the eyes of a different narrator was a gamble, but I think it worked, and would love to see more of that in the future(maybe with alignment flair?) I would have liked more Jun(ko) interaction, but I'm guessing that's been saved for the next book.
This was worth both the time and price
I have been waiting for this for a while and i was not disappointed! The story pulled me in as always and the ending of book 3 had screaming, can't wait for book 4!
Love it all so far can't wait to play more in the future.

The story was immersive but it was also confusing. It wasn't always clear what the game wanted from me, which forced me to restart multiple times. Also the ending was just terrible and extremely unsatisfying. I'm sad to have to give it only 3 stars, I didn't have a problem with the first 2 episodes. Hopefully they do better on the next one.
